resources.name: vehicle_locations
resources.description: Timestamped vehicle locations and speeds.

resources.name: passenger_events
resources.description: Timestamped passenger-related events, including boardings and alightings.

resources.name: fare_transactions
resources.description: Timestamped fare transaction, associated with devices.

resources.name: stop_visits
resources.description: Summarized boarding, alighting, arrival, departure, and other events (kneel engaged, ramp deployed, etc.) by trip and stop for each service date.

resources.name: trips_performed
resources.description: Trips performed for each service date.

resources.name: station_activities
resources.description: Summarized transactions, entries, and exits by stop or station and time period for each service date (for events not associated with a trip).

resources.name: devices
resources.description: Measurement devices, such as AVL, APC, and AFC devices, associated with vehicles or stops or stations.

resources.name: movement
resources.description: Handles day-of-week and time-of-day restrictions on movements.

resources.name: use_definition
resources.description: The Use_Definition file defines the characteristics of each vehicle type or non-travel purpose (e.g., a shoulder or parking lane). A two-way left turn lane (TWLTL) is also a use.

resources.name: use_group
resources.description: Defines groupings of uses, to reduce the size of the allowed_uses lists in the other tables.

resources.name: time_set_definitions
resources.description: The time_set_definitions file is an optional representation of time-of-day and day-of-week sets to enable time restrictions through `_tod` files.

resources.name: segment
resources.description: A portion of a link defined by `link_id`,`ref_node_id`, `start_lr`, and `end_lr`. Values in the segment will override they value specified in the link table. When one segment is fully contained within another, its value prevails.

resources.name: segment_lane
resources.description: Defines added and dropped lanes, and changes to lane parameters. If a lane is added, it has no parent. If it is changed or dropped, the parent_lane_id field keys to the associated lane on the lane table.

resources.name: signal_controller
resources.description: The signal controller is associated with an intersection or a cluster of intersections.

resources.name: signal_coordination
resources.description: Establishes coordination for several signal controllers, associated with a timing_plan.

resources.name: signal_phase_mvmt
resources.description: Associates Movements and pedestrian Links (e.g., crosswalks) with signal phases. A signal phase may be associated with several movements. A Movement may also run on more than one phase.

resources.name: signal_timing_plan
resources.description: For signalized nodes, establishes timing plans.

resources.name: signal_timing_phase
resources.description: For signalized nodes, provides signal timing and establishes phases that may run concurrently.

resources.name: signal_detector
resources.description: A signal detector is associated with a controller, a phase and a group of lanes.

resources.name: segment_tod
resources.description: An optional file that handles day-of-week and time-of-day restrictions on segments. It is used for part-time changes in segment capacity and number of lanes.
